page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The village lost its right to graze animals on Cow Common in 1908. This land is now farm land along the Eyeworth Road. Animals were allowed to graze on Charity Commisioners land of the High Street. That right has since gone and houses have been built there. On Good Friday 1887 a new Chapel was opened. This replaced an old barn chapel that had collapsed. A notable village personality named in Kelly's Directory 1885 was Mr. Henry James King, a farmer living at Home Farm a friend of W.G.Grace, huntsman,J.P. and generous friend to the village.
